perturbation.original_text:
2.5               Sponsor's Fee

For the  services  of the  Sponsor as sponsor  of the  Offering  and as full and complete  compensation  therefor,  the Issuer will pay to the Sponsor the sum of $32,100  (inclusive  of  Goods  and  Services  Tax),  the  receipt  of  which is acknowledged by the Sponsor.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.5               Sponsor's Fee

For the  services  of the  Sponsor as sponsor  of the  Offering  and as full and complete  compensation  therefor,  the Issuer will pay to the Sponsor the sum of $32,100  (inclusive  of  Goods  and  Services  Tax). The initial payment of $10,000 is due upon signing this agreement, and the remaining balance will be paid within 90 days of the offering's completion.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the payment schedule for the Sponsor's fee. Originally, the text implied a single payment upon receipt acknowledgement. The modified text splits the payment into an initial payment and a final payment 90 days after the offering completion, which contradicts the original intention. The uncertainty on when to pay the full ammount can create dispute in the contractual obligation.

perturbation.original_text:
3.3               Survival of Representations and Warranties

Each of the parties  hereto  acknowledges  that the other parties are relying on each of the representations  and warranties  addressed to such other parties set forth in section 3.1 or 3.2, as the case may be, and any representations made in any  certificate  issued to such other parties in connection with this Agreement notwithstanding  any  investigations  heretofore or hereafter made by such other parties  or their  counsel  or  representatives.  All such  representations  and warranties  shall not merge in or be  prejudiced  by,  and shall  survive  for a period of three years from the completion of the distribution of the Units.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.3               Survival of Representations and Warranties

Each of the parties  hereto  acknowledges  that the other parties are relying on each of the representations  and warranties  addressed to such other parties set forth in section 3.1 or 3.2, as the case may be, and any representations made in any  certificate  issued to such other parties in connection with this Agreement notwithstanding  any  investigations  heretofore or hereafter made by such other parties  or their  counsel  or  representatives.  All such  representations  and warranties  shall not merge in or be  prejudiced  by,  and shall  survive indefinitely from the date of signing this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies that representations and warranties survive for three years after the completion of the distribution. The modified text states that these representations and warranties survive indefinitely from the date of signing the agreement. This creates a contradiction in the contract regarding the duration of the survival period for the warranties, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
6.1               Term of Agreement

This Agreement shall  terminate and,  subject to the provisions set forth below, be of no further  force or effect on the exercise by the Sponsor of its right to terminate  this Agreement as provided in subsection  6.2,  provided that, in any event,  sections  3, 7 and 8 and, in the event that such  termination  occurs by virtue of paragraph  6.2(b),  subsection 2.5 shall not terminate  (except as set forth  therein)  and shall  continue in full force and effect for the benefit of the Sponsor or the other parties to this Agreement, as the case may be.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.1               Term of Agreement

This Agreement shall  terminate and,  subject to the provisions set forth below, be of no further  force or effect on the exercise by the Sponsor of its right to terminate  this Agreement as provided in subsection  6.2. Notwithstanding the foregoing, this agreement shall automatically renew for successive one-year terms unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 30 days prior to the end of the then-current term, provided that, in any event,  sections  3, 7 and 8 and, in the event that such  termination  occurs by virtue of paragraph  6.2(b),  subsection 2.5 shall not terminate  (except as set forth  therein)  and shall  continue in full force and effect for the benefit of the Sponsor or the other parties to this Agreement, as the case may be.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement terminates upon certain conditions in section 6.2. The modified text introduces an automatic renewal clause for successive one-year terms unless notice is given. This creates a direct contradiction about the agreement's termination; it can either terminate as described in 6.2 or automatically renew. This ambiguity could lead to disputes regarding the agreement's validity after the initial term.
